datetime.format.label: Date/time format:
datetime.format.description:
The date and time format to be parsed
(see 'to_stream formatting' in Howard E. Hinnant's C++ date.h library documentation for details).

datetime.locale.label: Date/time locale:
datetime.locale.description:
Locale used for parsing the date and time
(e.g. 'en_US.UTF8', see C++ 'std::locale' documentary for details).

datetime.query.label: Date/time query:
datetime.query.description: Query used for parsing the date and time.

datetime.source.label: Date/time source:
datetime.source.description: Where from to parse the date and the time.

field.names.label: Field names:
field.names.description: The names of the custom fields to parse.

field.queries.label: Field queries:
field.queries.description: The queries used to parse the custom fields.

field.sources.label: Field sources:
field.sources.description: Where from to parse the custom fields.

id.source.label: ID source:
id.source.description: Where from to parse the ID.

newest.only.description: Parse only the newest content for each URL.

result.multi.separator.description: Separator used when parsing a field that gives multiple results.

result.multi-quotes.description: Quotes used when parsing a field that can give multiple results.

result.table.label: Result table:
result.table.description: Table name to save parsed fields to.

sleep.idle.description: Time (in ms) to wait before checking for new URLs when all URLs have been parsed.

sleep.mysql.description: Time (in s) to wait before last try to re-connect to mySQL server.
